Summary: Observed a circular, oval shaped from my position object with a solid band of white lights around it. One white light was brighter than all the rest. it would randomly blink red & greenish-blue lights around the sides of it. The underside was dark.
divs: sighting detailson november 27, 2011 at 1:30 am i was getting ready to retire for the evening and went to check the back sliding door to be sure it was locked. i noticed an extremely bright white light in the western sky. larger than all the other stars. we live in a flight path so at first i though it was an airplane. the "airplane" did not move (did not get any closer). the object appeared to be an oval shaped disk with what appeared to be a solid band of lights around it, with one light larger and brighter than the rest. i could make out the outline of the object and the underside appeared dark, almost black in the night sky. it would randomly blink red and greenish-blue lights. every so often i would see like short beams of light coming out at an angle from the underside. like a child would draw lines around a sun to depict rays. i made two other people observe this object. i stayed up for 1 1\2 hours observing these lights (and disk shaped object) that never moved from its position and finally went to bed at 2:40 am. it was a perfectly clear night. my reaction was at first it must be an airplane, when it never moved and i went outside to get a better look and realized the shape of it i thought, this has to be a ufo. i started looking online to see if any other reports were posted anywhere. did find one in ohio. i tried to get a picture and a video of it on my cell phone but that did not work. a planet is not oval shaped and does not pulse colored lights. helicopters make noise. i kept going outside to try to get a better look and memorize what i was seeing. it scared me and excited me at the same time and i am very frustrated that so far no one else saw this. i would like to know what i was seeing.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Monroe Township
There were no other sightings in Monroe Township on or around November 27th 2011
